text.div:
This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/us/medmorph/CodeSystem/us-ph-triggerdefinition-namedevents defines the following codes:

LvlCodeDisplayDefinition
1encounter-change Indicates a change in the patient's encounter recordsIndicates a change in the patient's encounter records which includes starting an encounter, closing an encounter, modifying data elements of an encounter. Encounter change events would be triggered by monitoring the Encounter resource.
2  encounter-start Indicates the start of an encounterIndicates the start of an encounter, where in encounter.period.low is populated with the start time.
2  encounter-end Indicates the end of an encounterIndicates the end of an encounter, where in encounter.period.high is populated with the end time or the encounter.status='finished'.
2  encounter-modified Indicates modifications to data elements of an encounterIndicates changes to encounter codes, times, reason codes, diagnosis, discharge dispositions, locations etc.
1diagnosis-change Indicates change in a patient's diagnosisIndicates change in a patient's diagnosis and it includes new diagnosis or modifications to existing diagnosis. Diagnosis change events would be triggered by monitoring the Condition resource.
2  new-diagnosis New Diagnosis addedIndicates that a new diagnosis has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR
2  modified-diagnosis Existing Diagnosis record has been modifiedIndicates that an existing diagnosis record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing diagnosis record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new diagnosis record.
1medication-change Indicates change in a patient's medicationsIndicates change in a patient's medications and it includes changes to Administered medications or Requested medications or Dispensed medications. Medication change events would be triggered by monitoring the MedicationRequest, MedicationDispense, MedicationStatement and MedicationAdministration resources.
2  new-medication New Medication addedIndicates that a new MedicationRequest or MedicationDispense or MedicationAdministered or MedicationStatement has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR
2  modified-medication Existing Medication record has been modifiedIndicates that an existing medication record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing medication record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new medication record.
1labresult-change Indicates change in a patient's labresultsIndicates change in a patient's lab results and it includes new lab results or modifications to existing lab results. Changes to lab results could be because of change in the lab result values, lab test names, times or other data elements of the Observation resource where the category is laboratory. LabResult events would be triggered by monitoring the Observation resource with an Observation.category=laboratory.
2  new-labresult New Lab Result addedIndicates that a new Lab Result has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR
2  modified-labresult Existing Lab Result record has been modifiedIndicates that an existing lab result record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing lab result record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new lab result record. Changes to lab results could be because of change in the lab result values, lab test names, times or other data elements of the Observation resource where the category is laboratory.
1order-change Indicates change in a patient's ordersIndicates change in a patient's orders and it includes new or modified ServiceRequests. Order change events would be triggered by monitoring the ServiceRequest resource.
2  new-order New Order addedIndicates that a new ServiceRequest has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR
2  modified-order Existing Order record has been modifiedIndicates that an existing ServiceRequest record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing ServiceRequest record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new ServiceRequest record.
1procedure-change Indicates change in a patient's proceduresIndicates change in a patient's procedures and it includes new procedures or modifications to existing procedures. Procedure events would be triggered by monitoring the Procedure resource.
2  new-procedure New Procedure addedIndicates that a new procedure has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR
2  modified-procedure Existing Procedure record has been modifiedIndicates that an existing procedure record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing procedure record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new procedure record.
1immunization-change Indicates change in a patient's immunizationsIndicates change in a patient's immunization and it includes new immunizations or modifications to existing immunization records. Immunization change events would be triggered by monitoring the Immunization resource.
2  new-immunization New Immunization addedIndicates that a new immunization has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR
2  modified-immunization Existing immunization record has been modifiedIndicates that an existing immunization record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing immunization record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new immunization record.
1demographic-change Indicates change in patient demographicsIndicates that the Patient demographic attributes such as Date of Birth, Race, Ethnicity, Deceased date, Address, Telecom, Names have changed. Demographic change events would be triggered by monitoring the Patient resource.
1received-public-health-report Indicates receipt of a public health reportIndicates that a public health report was submitted and received by a specific system. This event could trigger downstream processing and hence is designated as a named event.
1received-public-health-response Indicates receipt of a public health response for a submitted public health reportIndicates that a public health response was received by a specific system for an already submitted public health report. This event could trigger downstream processing and hence is designated as a named event.
1timer-event A Timer is setup to kick off processing.Indicates a timer based approach to start processing.
2  periodic-timer Setup Periodic TimerIndicates that processing must be performed periodically based on a specified duration.
2  absolute-timer Setup Absolute TimerIndicates that processing must be performed at a specific time.

name: USPublicHealthTriggerDefinitionNamedEvents
title: US Public Health TriggerDefinition Named Events
publisher: HL7 International - Public Health Work Group
description: The US Public Health TriggerDefinition NamedEvents CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying named events to subscribe to in clinical workflows.

concept.display: Indicates a change in the patient's encounter records
concept.definition: Indicates a change in the patient's encounter records which includes starting an encounter, closing an encounter, modifying data elements of an encounter. Encounter change events would be triggered by monitoring the Encounter resource.

concept.display: Indicates the start of an encounter
concept.definition: Indicates the start of an encounter, where in encounter.period.low is populated with the start time.

concept.display: Indicates the end of an encounter
concept.definition: Indicates the end of an encounter, where in encounter.period.high is populated with the end time or the encounter.status='finished'.

concept.display: Indicates modifications to data elements of an encounter
concept.definition: Indicates changes to encounter codes, times, reason codes, diagnosis, discharge dispositions, locations etc.

concept.display: Indicates change in a patient's diagnosis
concept.definition: Indicates change in a patient's diagnosis and it includes new diagnosis or modifications to existing diagnosis. Diagnosis change events would be triggered by monitoring the Condition resource.

concept.display: New Diagnosis added
concept.definition: Indicates that a new diagnosis has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR

concept.display: Existing Diagnosis record has been modified
concept.definition: Indicates that an existing diagnosis record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing diagnosis record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new diagnosis record.

concept.display: Indicates change in a patient's medications
concept.definition: Indicates change in a patient's medications and it includes changes to Administered medications or Requested medications or Dispensed medications. Medication change events would be triggered by monitoring the MedicationRequest, MedicationDispense, MedicationStatement and MedicationAdministration resources.

concept.display: New Medication added
concept.definition: Indicates that a new MedicationRequest or MedicationDispense or MedicationAdministered or MedicationStatement has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR

concept.display: Existing Medication record has been modified
concept.definition: Indicates that an existing medication record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing medication record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new medication record.

concept.display: Indicates change in a patient's labresults
concept.definition: Indicates change in a patient's lab results and it includes new lab results or modifications to existing lab results. Changes to lab results could be because of change in the lab result values, lab test names, times or other data elements of the Observation resource where the category is laboratory. LabResult events would be triggered by monitoring the Observation resource with an Observation.category=laboratory.

concept.display: New Lab Result added
concept.definition: Indicates that a new Lab Result has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR

concept.display: Existing Lab Result record has been modified
concept.definition: Indicates that an existing lab result record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing lab result record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new lab result record. Changes to lab results could be because of change in the lab result values, lab test names, times or other data elements of the Observation resource where the category is laboratory.

concept.display: Indicates change in a patient's orders
concept.definition: Indicates change in a patient's orders and it includes new or modified ServiceRequests. Order change events would be triggered by monitoring the ServiceRequest resource.

concept.display: New Order added
concept.definition: Indicates that a new ServiceRequest has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR

concept.display: Existing Order record has been modified
concept.definition: Indicates that an existing ServiceRequest record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing ServiceRequest record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new ServiceRequest record.

concept.display: Indicates change in a patient's procedures
concept.definition: Indicates change in a patient's procedures and it includes new procedures or modifications to existing procedures. Procedure events would be triggered by monitoring the Procedure resource.

concept.display: New Procedure added
concept.definition: Indicates that a new procedure has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR

concept.display: Existing Procedure record has been modified
concept.definition: Indicates that an existing procedure record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing procedure record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new procedure record.

concept.display: Indicates change in a patient's immunizations
concept.definition: Indicates change in a patient's immunization and it includes new immunizations or modifications to existing immunization records. Immunization change events would be triggered by monitoring the Immunization resource.

concept.display: New Immunization added
concept.definition: Indicates that a new immunization has been added to a patient's chart in the EHR

concept.display: Existing immunization record has been modified
concept.definition: Indicates that an existing immunization record in a patient's chart has been modified. Sometimes this is equivalent to removing an existing immunization record (which may have been entered in error) and adding a new immunization record.

concept.display: Indicates change in patient demographics
concept.definition: Indicates that the Patient demographic attributes such as Date of Birth, Race, Ethnicity, Deceased date, Address, Telecom, Names have changed. Demographic change events would be triggered by monitoring the Patient resource.

concept.display: Indicates receipt of a public health report
concept.definition: Indicates that a public health report was submitted and received by a specific system. This event could trigger downstream processing and hence is designated as a named event.

concept.display: Indicates receipt of a public health response for a submitted public health report
concept.definition: Indicates that a public health response was received by a specific system for an already submitted public health report. This event could trigger downstream processing and hence is designated as a named event.

concept.display: A Timer is setup to kick off processing.
concept.definition: Indicates a timer based approach to start processing.

concept.display: Setup Periodic Timer
concept.definition: Indicates that processing must be performed periodically based on a specified duration.

concept.display: Setup Absolute Timer
concept.definition: Indicates that processing must be performed at a specific time.
